----- Original Message -----
From: "Peter Spitz" <pspitz@...>


>
> This is overly simplistic, but:
>
> - If you have any bugs in your production code, you're testing too little.
> - If your production code is flawless, but you have no time to add
features,
> you might be testing too much.
>

In most commercial software products there will always be bugs regardless of
how much you test. You may get to the point where you can no longer find
bugs, but that doesn't mean they aren't there. Some small niche software
efforts, such as flight control software for the Space Shuttle has been
asserted to be zero defect, but they don't know that for sure because it is
impossible to completely test non-trivial logic, and therefore impossible to
be sure.

FWIW,
Lauren
